meanings.definition: To sleep longer or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys outsleeping her sister on weekends.
meanings.sent2: He is always outsleeping his roommate in the mornings.
meanings.sent3: The cat seems to be outsleeping the dog lately.
meanings.sent4: The champion boxer outsleeps all his opponents before a big match.
meanings.sent5: Outsleeping is like winning a silent competition of rest.

meanings.definition: The act of sleeping longer or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Outsleeping can lead to feeling more refreshed in the morning.
meanings.sent2: His constant outsleeping annoys his friends.
meanings.sent3: The outsleeping of the bear in winter is quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The outsleeping of the owl during the day is a marvel of nature.
meanings.sent5: The outsleeping of the sloth is legendary in the animal kingdom.
